item.title: Sarah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "The best stories don't come from "good vs. bad" but "good vs. good." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "Sometimes I write drunk and revise sober, and sometimes I write sober and revise drunk. But you have to have both elements in creation â€” the Apollonian and the Dionysian, or spontaneity and restraint, emotion and discipline." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Sarah add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "I never know what I think about something until I read what I've written on it." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Sarah add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I have always lived violently, drunk hugely, eaten too much or not at all, slept around the clock or missed two nights of sleeping, worked too hard and too long in glory, or slobbed for a time in utter laziness. I've lifted, pulled, chopped, climbed, made love with joy and taken my hangovers as a consequence, not as a punishment." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "A sad soul can kill you quicker, far quicker, than a germ." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sarah add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Don't worry about losing. If it is right, it happens - The main thing is not to hurry. Nothing good gets away." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sarah add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "From this day to the ending of the world, But we in it shall be remembered- We few, we happy few, we band of brothers; For he to-day that sheds his blood with me Shall be my brother; be he neâ€™er so vile, This day shall gentle his condition; And gentlemen in England now-a-bed Shall think themselves accursâ€™d they were not here, And hold their manhoods cheap whiles any speaks That fought with us upon Saint Crispinâ€™s day." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "Remember, remember always, that all of us, and you and I especially, are descended from immigrants and revolutionists." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: Sarah add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city." -- George Burns

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "But I'm Crazy. I swear to God I am." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Always do what you are afraid to do." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Hell is empty and all the devils are here." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Walt Disney Company
item.description: "No matter how your heart is grieving, if you keep on believing, the dreams that you wish will come true." -- Walt Disney Company

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Santosh Kalwar
item.description: "I was smiling yesterday,I am smiling today and I will smile tomorrow.Simply because life is too short to cry for anything." -- Santosh Kalwar

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Agatha Christi
item.description: "I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing." -- Agatha Christi

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Never travel faster than your guardian angel can fly." -- Mother Teresa
